intro: Uncaria surinamensis, commonly known as the climbing evergreen vine, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
